strapiEdition.headline: It's a Bird! It's a Plane! It's a... Cookie?

posts.title: Registration Now Open for Walmart Women‚Äôs Empowerment Summit Benefiting NextUp
posts.content:
The Northwest Arkansas chapter of NextUp invites the community to join the 2023 Walmart Women's Empowerment Summit presented by Kimberly-Clark at the Rogers Convention Center on Sep 28.

Let‚Äôs Connect: Hosted in conjunction with the Walmart NW Arkansas LPGA Championship, this year's event will focus on Unlocking the Power of Connection. With the rise of remote and hybrid workplaces, the summit will provide valuable insights on building relationships and fostering a sense of community both personally and professionally.

Inspired & Empowered: Gain valuable knowledge, form lasting connections, and hear renowned speakers like New York Times Bestselling Author, Peloton Instructor, Nike Athlete, and Change Maker Tunde Oyeneyin, along with Leadership Coach and Wall Street Journal Bestselling Author Ryan Jenkins and several local business leaders.

Registration is open to all but discounted for NextUp members. Secure your spot while tickets last HERE.

posts.title: Ontario and Northwest Arkansas Strengthen Trade Ties
posts.content:
Ontario's Minister of Economic Development, Victor Fedeli, visited Bentonville earlier this week for conversations with Arkansas leadership regarding increasing trade between the regions. Canada is Arkansas‚Äôs largest trade partner, with nearly $1b worth of rice and poultry being exported to Ontario each year.

Direct Route: On Sunday, Fedeli met with regional leaders at the Northwest Arkansas National Airport to discuss establishing a direct flight to Toronto, then toured several venues in Downtown Bentonville, including the Ledger.

Triple the Trade: Conversations continued Monday at the Momentary with government officials and business leaders, establishing deeper relationships and setting goals to increase bilateral trade between Ontario and Northwest Arkansas from $2b to $6b by 2027.

Find more details in Talk Business & Politics HERE.

posts.title: Walmart Celebrates Completion of 10,000+ Drone Deliveries
posts.content:
Walmart has completed over 10,000 safe drone deliveries and celebrated the milestone with its most epic drone delivery yet‚Ä¶

The Dunk: In honor of the most popular item delivered by drone ‚Äî the OREO Family Size Pack ‚Äî Walmart teamed up with OREO to dunk a 2ft cookie into a giant glass of milk via drone. Watch the video here.

The Party Continues: Drone delivery orders placed through the end of this week will receive a complimentary package of OREO cookies. Drone deliveries are currently available from stores in Farmington, Bentonville, Rogers, and Pea Ridge.

See if your address is eligible for Walmart drone deliveries at DroneUp or Zipline.

posts.title: Keep Our Local Bike Trails in Top Shape With Trailblazers
posts.content:
Join the Trailblazers Trail Adoption Program (TAP) for a Trail Luv Day at Huntley Gravity Zone, raking and weeding the Uphill Both Ways and Rendezvous trails on Aug 26 from 9a-12p.

Go to Work: TAP will provide all the necessary tools, as well as free food and drinks! Just bring your own gloves! Additionally, a trail education meeting is scheduled for Aug 31 at Handcut Hollow from 6-8p for those interested in learning about trail maintenance and fall preparation.

Adopt a Trail: If you're interested in adopting a trail, there are several in dire need of adopters, including Landline, Handcut Hollow Traverse, Tunnel Vision, and Mad Hatter at Wonderland. Email Trailblazers for more information.

Learn more about TAP and how to get involved HERE.
